requirement: Requirement 1 - Install and Maintain Network Security Controls

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Requirement 1 lays the foundation for PCI DSS compliance by establishing network security controls at the perimeter and internally. PCI DSS v4.0 adds flexibility for custom approaches, provided control objectives are met.

sections.title: Requirement 1 at a Glance
sections.content:
- Build secure network boundaries.
- Control inbound and outbound traffic.
- Review ports, protocols, and services regularly.
- Justify each connection's business need.
- Protect against unauthorized network access, including cloud and virtual segmentation.

sections.title: What This Means in Practice
sections.content: Businesses must implement firewalls or equivalent controls, document business justifications, and regularly review network access paths. Minimum compliance means having static firewalls with yearly reviews; maturity includes automated change detection.

sections.title: Gotchas
sections.content:
- Leaving cloud security groups unreviewed.
- Unused interfaces left open.
- Scoping errors from outdated network diagrams.

sections.title: Trusted Advisor (TA) Tip
sections.content: Treat cloud VPCs and security groups with the same rigor as firewalls. Build automated alerting for unauthorized network changes.

content.Executive Lens: Supports business resilience and protects brand reputation.
content.Security & Infra Teams Lens: Focuses on least privilege and traffic restrictions.
content.QSA/Consultant Lens: Look for up-to-date diagrams, firewall configs, and rule justifications.
content.Small Business Lens: Use managed firewall services and document access rules carefully.

sections.title: Call to Action (CTA)
sections.content: Review your firewall rules and cloud security groups today for scope alignment.
